safire.learning.models.base_unsupervised_model module¶

class safire.learning.models.base_unsupervised_model.BaseUnsupervisedModel(inputs, n_in, n_out)[source]¶

Bases: safire.learning.models.base_model.BaseModel

error(X)[source]¶

Returns the proportion of incorrectly classified instances.

Parameters:X (theano.tensor.TensorType) – A response vector. Note that in an unsupervised model, this is not the response like in the supervised model – more likely it’s the input data themselves.
Raises:NotImplementedError()
classmethod link(model_instance, layer_index, **model_init_args)[source]¶

Constructs a model for pretraining the model_instance layer given by layer_index. Does NOT provide the training function, only constructs the model with all links correctly initialized.

Parameters:
  • model – The model instance which should be pre-trained.
  • layer_index (int) – Which layer of model_instance to link to.

Starting with 0, the output layer of the model would be index model_instance.n_layers - 1.

Parameters:model_init_args (kwargs) – Various keyword arguments passed to

pretraining model constructor.

Return type:BaseUnsupervisedModel
Returns:An instance of cls linked to the given layer of

the given supervised model.

classmethod setup(data, model=None, batch_size=500, learning_rate=0.13, heavy_debug=False, **model_init_kwargs)[source]¶

Prepares the train_model, validate_model and test_model methods on the given dataset and with the given parameters.

It is a CLASS METHOD, which during its run actually creates an instance of the model. It is called as

>>> model_handle = ModelClass.setup(dataset, params...)

The dataset is normally expected to provide information about the input and output dimension of the model. However, this is not true in a purely unsupervised setting, where the unsupervised model is not used for pre-training. In this case, the output dimension of the model must be specified extra through the model_init_kwargs argument.**

Warning

If the output dimension is given both by the dataset and by the kwargs, the kwargs take priority. It is assumed that a purely unsupervised setting applies. (Datasets may serve multiple purposes while the model is already set up for a more specific purpose.)

If a model is passed, the output dimension is simply copied from the model, disregarding the dataset (since the initialized model will be using this model’s dimensions anyway) - the output dimension is NOT checked against the dataset in this case (while the input, of course, is).

Parameters:
  • data (Dataset) – The dataset on which the model will be run. Note that this setup typically expects that the dataset knows in advance what its both input and output dimensions are; in a purely unsupervised setting, we’ll have to deal with n_out separately. TODO!!!
  • model (BaseUnsupervisedModel) – A model instance that the setup should use.
  • batch_size (int) – how many data items will be in one minibatch (the data is split to minibatches for training, validation and testing)
  • learning_rate (theano.config.floatX) – How fast will the model move in the direction of the gradient.
  • heavy_debug (bool) – Turns on debug prints from Theano functions.
  • model_init_kwargs (kwargs) –

    Various keyword arguments that get passed to the model constructor. See constructor argument documentation.

    Warning

    In a purely unsupervised setting, the dataset doesn’t define the output dimension. In this case, n_out must be supplied as a keyword argument here.
Return type:

ModelHandle
Returns:

ModelHandle(model, train_f, validate_f, test_f) where model is the Model instance initialized during setup() and the _func variables are compiled theano.functions to use in a learner.
classmethod setup_as_pretraining(data, supervised_model_instance, linked_layer_index, batch_size=500, learning_rate=0.13, **model_init_args)[source]¶

Links a model instance to the link_layer_index-th layer of supervised_model_instance for pre-training and generates the pretraining function. Returns a PretrainingModelHandle that contains the pretraining model instance and the pretraining function.

Parameters:
  • data (Dataset) – The dataset on which pre-training should work.
  • model – The model instance which should be pre-trained.
  • linked_layer_index (int) – Which layer of model_instance to

link to. Starting with 0, the output layer of the model would be index model_instance.n_layers - 1.

Parameters:batch_size (int) – how many data items will be in one minibatch

(the data is split to minibatches for training, validation and testing)

Parameters:learning_rate (theano.config.floatX) – How fast will the model move in the direction

of the gradient.

Parameters:model_init_args (kwargs) – Various keyword arguments passed to

pretraining model constructor.
